column2: "Yes, I am Luther, but who are you people and why are you shouting my name like that?"
"There isn't many who can recognize my face and attach a name to it."
"Unless of course, you're an agent of Lutz..."
"Brother, surely you jest. This is the person who helped me while I was being chased."
"You lack forsight, Harriet. Did you not stop to think that perhaps this is some kind of ploy? Perhaps to pinpoint where we've been hiding?"
"Brother!"
"I understand, I get it, please calm down. The heir to the throne should not shout."
"The same goes to my older brother."
"I'm no longer an heir, right? Consequently, there's nothing that bounds my thoughts, actions and my subject of research."
"I see... This must be what Alma was talking about!"
"The records of the universe are all messed up. Because this is a dream that the Akashic Record is having, anything can happen."
"Although, to think that Luther is Harriet's older brother, this exceeds disorder..."
"Hey!? What's going on!?"
"Hmm... this is a fairy of legend, isn't it?"
"And you there... You're a visitor from another world as told by the legend."
"So, you understand!?"
"I am the forerunner of magical research. If we were to study your flow of Mana, it would be obvious to say. It's different than those who are born from this world."
"In this land, I was the one who gave rise on how to conduct summonings. I doubt I'd make it far without a belief in alternate worlds, would I?"
"Nevertheless, you understand speech and yet you're able to fly, yes?"
"Although it's as expected of something from legend, it's quite fascinating."
"If you do not mind, may I research you?"
"Even if he's in another world, he's still the same!"
"Hey <%me>! Listen! Hey! <%me>! Please help me!"
"1. Perhaps for another time"
"2. Please don't tease her"
"Hmm, alright. Now, for the main question ahead."
"I'm being serious... Oh, it seems my sister's sore gaze is staring at me. I suppose we shall move forward with the main issue at hand."
"Allow me to explain the current state of this country and the effects caused by the war."
